question.title: Flutter project problems: Unsupported class file major version 65
question.body:
I have problems in my flutter project (Android studio) so that I'm not able to build an APK with the command flutter build apk.

If I start the application with run main.dart over a USB cable then the build is working. I have done a release 1 month ago and in the meantime it just stopped working. I did not change any settings. I just added a few dependencies into pubspec.yaml.

After this I have read for Unsupported class file major version 65 that Java version and gradle version are not compatible.

I have installed the latest Android studio. Downgraded Java from 22 to 21. Does anybody know how to fix my situation?

Gradle

    distributionBase=GRADLE_USER_HOME
    distributionPath=wrapper/dists
    zipStoreBase=GRADLE_USER_HOME
    zipStorePath=wrapper/dists
    distributionUrl=https\://services.gradle.org/distributions/gradle-8.4-all.zip

gradlew -version

     ./gradlew -version 
    ------------------------------------------------------------
    Gradle 8.0
    ------------------------------------------------------------

    Revision:     62ab9b7c7f884426cf79fbedcf07658b2dbe9e97
    Kotlin:       1.8.10
    Groovy:       3.0.13
    Ant:          Apache Ant(TM) version 1.10.11 compiled on July 10 2021
    JVM:          21.0.7 (Oracle Corporation 21.0.7+8-LTS-245)
    OS:           Windows 11 10.0 amd64

Java

    PS G:\Source\mobile_bo_app_developmentWeb\android> java -version
    java version "21.0.7" 2025-04-15 LTS
    Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 21.0.7+8-LTS-245)
    Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 21.0.7+8-LTS-245, mixed mode, sharing)

**android/app/build.gradle** 

     kotlinOptions {
        jvmTarget = "18" //If i don't add this line build is not working8.3
     }

android/settings.gradle

    plugins {
    id "dev.flutter.flutter-plugin-loader" version "1.0.0"
    id "com.android.application" version "8.3.2" apply false
    }

Flutter doctor

answers.body:
1. First step you need to ensure that the "Gradle Wrapper" in the file android/gradle/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.properties.

    Support "Java 21".

    Depending on the "Gradle" doc, only Gradle 8.4 officially supports Java 21.

  2. In the file android/build.gradle or android/settings.gradle, ensure that you are using AGP 8.3.2 or higher. Don't use AGP < 8.2 if you are using Java 21.

  3. Run the command flutter doctor -v, and then check which path Flutter is using for Java.

    Check if the line: Java binary at: refer to jdk 21.

  4. Clear your cache with the command flutter clean, and then flutter pub get.

  5. Use the command flutter build apk --verbose to get the full details of the build structure in the console to see the log

79654109.body: To change the AGP version, open the android/build.gradle file or android/settings.gradlefile.  Lokk after this block plugins {      id 'com.android.application' version '8.3.2' apply false      id 'com.android.library' version '8.3.2' apply false  }    And change the version of AGP to 8.4.0, this version support officialy in the jave 21.    After that run the commands:  flutter clean  flutter pub get  flutter build apk    if there is a still problem, run with --verbose to see the log

i have execuded the code and i get:  To keep the default AGP version Gradle version 8.3, download a compatible Java version (Java 17 <= (Java 17 <= compatible Java version < Java 21) Java version < Java 21). Configure this Java version globally for Flutter by running:  How can i change AGP version ? My distributionUrl=https\://services.gradle.org/distributions/g‌​radle-8.5-all.zip it should be  8.5 and not 8.3
I really don't want to build new application because i have already published app on app store and google play. Also my github histroy,...

You can run the command "flutter create -t app <app-directory>" and following this steps to build your new project correctly. Don't forget to create backup to your project before.    1.  Copy your files and directories from the /lib directory in the old project to the /lib directory in the new project.  2. Copy your pubspec.yaml to the new project from the old project.  3. Copy your /assets directory from the old project to the new project

if i run with --verbose. I get. Your app is using an unsupported Gradle project. To fix this problem, create a new project by running flutter create -t app <app-directory> and then move the dart code, assets and pubspec.yaml to the new project.
